text:
[Dasaratha relates to Kausalya the event of the noble ascetic's curse on him -- death of Dasaratha]

वधमप्रतिरूपं तु महर्षेस्तस्य राघवः।

विलपन्नेव धर्मात्मा कौसल्यां पुनरब्रवीत्।।2.64.1।।
meaning: धर्मात्मा the righteous one, राघवः descendant of the Raghu's (Dasaratha), तस्य महर्षेः that maharsi's, अप्रतिरूपम् unique, वधम् killing, विलपन्नेव while lamenting, पुनः again, कौशल्याम् to Kausalya, अब्रवीत् said.
translation: Grieving for having unfairly killed the great sage the rightenous descendant of the Raghus (Dasaratha) coutinued to tell Kausalya about it:

text:
तदज्ञानान्महत्पापं कृत्वाहं सङ्कुलेन्द्रियः।

एकस्त्वचिन्तयं बुध्या कथं नु सुकृतं भवेत्।।2.64.2।।
meaning: अहम् I, अज्ञानात् in ignorance, तत् that, महत् great, पापम् sin, कृत्वा having done, सङ्कुलेन्द्रियः with agitated senses, एकस्तु myself alone, कथं नु how, सुकृतम् well done, भवेत् shall be, बुध्या in my mind, अचिन्तयम् reflected.
translation:
Having committed the sin unwittingly, I was greatly agitated. I reflected in my mind as
to how to atone for this great sin.

text:
ततस्तं घटमादाय पूर्णं परमवारिणा।

आश्रमं तमहं प्राप्य यथाऽख्यातपथं गतः।।2.64.3।।
meaning: ततः then, परमवारिणा with clean water, पूर्णम् filled, तम् that, घटम् pot आदाय taking hold of, यथाऽख्यातपथम् the path as directed, प्राप्य having reached, अहम् I, अश्रमम् hermitage, गतः entered.
translation: Holding the pot filled with clean water I reached the hermitage following the path as directed.

text:
तत्राहं दुर्बलावन्धौ वृद्धावपरिणायकौ।

अपश्यं तस्य पितरौ लूनपक्षाविव द्विजौ।।2.64.4।।

तन्निमित्ताभिरासीनौ कथाभिरपरिश्रमौ।

तामाशां मत्कृते हीनावुदासीनावनाथवत्।।2.64.5।।
meaning: तत्र there, अहम् I, दुर्बलौ frail, अन्धौ blind, वृद्धौ old, अपरिणायकौ without any supporter, लूनपक्षौ with wings severed, द्विजौ इव like birds, तन्निमित्ताभिः on account of their son, कथाभिः with stories, आसीनौ seated, अपरिश्रमौ without any work, मत्कृते done by me, ताम् आशाम् their hope, हीनौ deprived of, अनाथवत् like orphans, उदासीनौ passive, तस्य his, पितरौ parents, अपश्यम् I saw.
translation: There I found his weak, blind, old parents. With no supporter, they looked like birds with clipped wings. They sat there helplessly like orphans and passively talking about their son, their only hope that I have deprived them of.

text:
तत्राहं दुर्बलावन्धौ वृद्धावपरिणायकौ।

अपश्यं तस्य पितरौ लूनपक्षाविव द्विजौ।।2.64.4।।

तन्निमित्ताभिरासीनौ कथाभिरपरिश्रमौ।

तामाशां मत्कृते हीनावुदासीनावनाथवत्।।2.64.5।।
meaning: तत्र there, अहम् I, दुर्बलौ frail, अन्धौ blind, वृद्धौ old, अपरिणायकौ without any supporter, लूनपक्षौ with wings severed, द्विजौ इव like birds, तन्निमित्ताभिः on account of their son, कथाभिः with stories, आसीनौ seated, अपरिश्रमौ without any work, मत्कृते done by me, ताम् आशाम् their hope, हीनौ deprived of, अनाथवत् like orphans, उदासीनौ passive, तस्य his, पितरौ parents, अपश्यम् I saw.
translation: There I found his weak, blind, old parents. With no supporter, they looked like birds with clipped wings. They sat there helplessly like orphans and passively talking about their son, their only hope that I have deprived them of.

text:
शोकोपहतचित्तश्च भयसन्त्रस्तचेतनः।

तच्चाऽश्रमपदं गत्वा भूयश्शोकमहं गतः।।2.64.6।।
meaning: शोकोपहत चित्तः च with mind smitten with grief, भयसन्त्रस्तचेतनः mind charged with apprehension, अहम् I, तत् that, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, गत्वा having reached, भूयः once again, शोकम् sorrow, गतः obtained.
translation: Smitten with grief and my heart throbbing with fear I reached the hermitage and my sorrow became manifold.

text:
पदशब्दं तु मे श्रुत्वा मुनिर्वाक्यमभाषत।

किं चिरायसि मे पुत्र पानीयं क्षिप्रमानय।।2.64.7।।
meaning: मे my, पदशब्दम् sound of footsteps, श्रुत्वा having heard, मुनिः sage, वाक्यम् words, अभाषत spoke this, पुत्र son, किम् why, चिरायसि are you delaying, क्षिप्रम् quickly, मे to me, पानीयम् water, आनय bring.
translation: Hearing the sound of my footsteps, the sage said 'O son why have you delayed? Bring me some water quickly'.

text:
यन्निमित्तमिदं तात सलिले क्रीडितं त्वया।

उत्कण्ठिता ते मातेयं प्रविश क्षिप्रमाश्रमम्।।2.64.8।।
meaning: तात O Dear child, त्वया by you, यन्निमित्तम् for whatever reason, सलिले in the water, इदम् this, क्रीडितम् sported, इयम् this, ते माता your mother, उत्कण्ठिता with anxicty, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आश्रमम् hermitage, प्रविश enter.
translation: 'O Dear child, whatever be the reason, you have been sporting in the water so long, come at once to the hermitage. Your mother is anxious.

text:
यद्व्यलीकं कृतं पुत्र मात्रा ते यदि वा मया।

न तन्मनसि कर्तव्यं त्वया तात तपस्विना।।2.64.9।।
meaning:
पुत्र son, ते your, मात्रा mother, यदिवा or, मया by myself, यत् any, व्यलीकम् displeasing act, कृतम् has been done, तात O Child, तपस्विना by being ascetic, त्वया by you, तत् that one,
मनसि in the mind, न कर्तव्यम् should not be taken seriously.
translation: 'O Child, O Son if your mother or I have done anything disagreeable, do not take it to heart, for you are an ascetic.

text:
त्वं गतिस्त्वगतीनां चक्षुस्त्वं हीनचक्षुषाम्।

समासक्तास्त्वयि प्राणाः किं त्वं नो नाभिभाषसे।।2.64.10।।
meaning: अगतीनाम् for us with no support, त्वम् you, गतिः are support, अचक्षुषाम् for us who have no eyes, त्वम् you, चक्षुः हि are our eyes, प्राणाः our vital life, त्वयि in you, समासक्ताः are attached, त्वम् you, नः to us, किम् why, नाभिभाषसे are not talking?
translation: 'You are a support to the supportless, eyes to the blind, you are our very vital life. Why don't you speak to us'?

text:
मुनिमव्यक्तया वाचा तमहं सज्जमानया।

हीनव्यञ्जनया प्रेक्ष्य भीतचित्त इवाब्रुवम्।।2.64.11।।
meaning: अहम् I, तं मुनिम् that sage, प्रेक्ष्य having seen, भीतचित्त इव with a frightened mind, अव्यक्तया indistinctly, सज्जमानया stammering, हीनव्यञ्जनया with slurring syllables, वाचा with words, अब्रुवम् I uttered.
translation: As I saw him, my heart was filled with terror and I stammered as I spoke in garbled sentences.

text:
मनसः कर्म चेष्टाभिरभिसंस्तभ्य वाग्बलम्।

आचचक्षे त्वहं तस्मै पुत्रव्यसनजं भयम्।।2.64.12।।
meaning: अहम् I, चेष्टाभिः with efforts, मनसः mind's, कर्म thoughts, वाग्बलम् power of speech, अभिसंस्तभ्य holding up firmly, तस्मै him, पुत्रव्यसनजम् the calamity arising due to the death of his son, भयम् fear, आचचक्षे related to him.
translation: After a lot of effort, with great fear controlling my thoughts and the power of speech, I related to him the calamity that had befallen his son.

text:
क्षत्रियोऽहं दशरथो नाहं पुत्रो महात्मनः।

सज्जनावमतं दुःखमिदं प्राप्तं स्वकर्मजम्।।2.64.13।।
meaning:
अहम् I, दशरथः Dasaratha, क्षत्रियः kshatriya, अहम् I, महात्मनः of the great, पुत्रः son, न not, सज्जनावमतम् condemnable by the virtuous, इदम् this, स्वकर्मजम् caused out of my own
action, दुःखम् sorrowful, प्राप्तम् has befallen.
translation: O magnanimous sage I am a kshatriya known as Dasaratha. I am not your son. A pathetic incident has been caused by my own action, condemnable by the virtuous.

text:
भगवंश्चापहस्तोऽहं सरयूतीरमागतः।

जिघांसुश्श्वापदं कञ्चिन्निपाने चाऽगतं गजम्।।2.64.14।।
meaning: भगवन् O revered one, अहम् I, चापहस्तः bow in hand, कञ्चित् a certain, श्वापदम् wild animal, निपाने drinking at the water hole, आगतम् which has come, गजं च an elephant, जिघांसुः wishing to kill, सरयूतीरम् to the bank of river Sarayu, आगतः arrived.
translation: Wishing to hunt a wild elephant coming down to the water hole for drinking, I went to the bank of Sarayu, bow in hand, O revered sage

text:
ततश्श्रुतो मया शब्दो जले कुम्भस्य पूर्यतः।

द्विपोऽयमिति मत्वाऽयं बाणेनाभिहतो मया।।2.64.15।।
meaning: ततः thereafter, मया by me, जले in the water, पूर्यतः being filled, कुम्भस्य pot's, शब्दः sound, श्रुतः was heard, अयम् this one, द्विपः इति taking for an elephant, मत्वा having thought, अयम् he, मया by me, बाणेन with arrow, अभिहतः was killed.
translation: There I heard the sound of a pot being filled with water and mistaking it to be an elephant's, shot an arrow.

text:
गत्वा नद्यास्तत स्तीरमपश्यमिषुणा हृदि।

विनिर्भिन्नं गतप्राणं शयानं भुवि तापसम्।।2.64.16।।
meaning: ततः then, नद्याः river's, तीरम् bank, गत्वा having gone, इषुणा with an arrow, हृदि in the chest, विनिर्भिन्नम् pierced it, गतप्राणम् with ebbing life, भुवि on the ground, शयानम् lying, तापसम् an ascetic, अपश्यम् I beheld.
translation: Thereafter I reached the river bank and beheld an ascetic with an arrow pierced in his chest. He was lying on the ground, his life ebbing away.

text:
भगवच्छशब्दमालक्ष्य मया गजजिघांसुना।

विसृप्टोऽम्भसि नाराचस्तेन ते निहतस्सुतः।।2.64.17।।
meaning: भगवन् O venerable one, शब्दम् sound, आलक्ष्य aiming at, गजजिघांसुना intending to kill an elephant, मया by me, अम्भसि in the water, नाराचः with an arrow, विसृष्टः has been released, तेन by that, ते your, सुतः son, निहतः was struck.
translation: O venerable one I released an arrow towards the water aiming at the sound intending to kill an elephant but it hit your son.

text:
ततस्तस्यैव वचनादुपेत्य परितप्यतः।

स मया सहसा बाण उधृतो मर्मतस्तदा।।2.64.18।।
meaning: ततः then, परितप्यतः tormented, तस्यैव by his own, वचनात् words, मया by me, तदा then, उपेत्य reaching him, सहसा at once, सः बाणः that arrow, मर्मतः from his vital part, उधृतः removed.
translation: Then I approached him. He was suffering from excruciating pain. I pulled out at his word the arrow from his chest.

text:
स चोधृतेन बाणेन तत्रैव स्वर्गमास्थितः।

भवन्तौ पितरौ शोचन्नन्धाविति विलप्य च।।2.64.19।।
meaning: सः च he also, पितरौ parents, भवन्तौ about both of you, शोचन् while grieving, अन्धौ इति saying you are blind, विलप्य च wailing, उधृतेन extracted, तेन बाणेन by that arrow, तत्रैव there itself, स्वर्गम् heaven, आस्थितः attained.
translation: Grieving for both of you and crying you are blind he died as soon as the arrow was pulled out.

text:
अज्ञानाद्भवतः पुत्र स्सहसाऽभिहतो मया।

शेषमेवं गते यत्स्यात्तत्प्रसीदतु मे मुनिः।।2.64.20।।
meaning: अज्ञानात् by my ignorance, सहसा suddenly, भवतः पुत्रः your son, मया by me, निहतः was slain, एवं गते when this has happened, यत् whatever, शेषं स्यात् remains to be done, तत् that, मुनिः ascetic, प्रसीदतु be pleased.
translation: Your son has been killed by me due to my ignorance. Since this has happened, may the ascetic be pleased to command me on the next course of action.

text:
स तच्च्रुत्वा वचः क्रूरं मयोक्तमघशंसिना।

नाशकत्तीव्रमायासमकर्तुं भगवानृषिः।।2.64.21।।
meaning: भगवान् venerable, सः ऋषिः that sage, अघशंसिना conveying my sinful act, मया by me, उक्तम् uttered, क्रूरम् cruel, तत् those, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तीव्रम् intense, आयासम् anguish, अकर्तुम् not to do, नाशकत् was not able.
translation: The venerable sage heard my cruel words about the sinful act and was not able to seriously react. (He was stunned).

text:
स बाष्पपूर्णवदनो निश्श्वसन्शोककर्शितः।

मामुवाच महातेजाः कृताञ्जलिमुपस्थितम्।।2.64.22।।
meaning: महातेजाः brilliant, सः that ascetic, बाष्पपूर्णवदनः face filled with tears, निश्श्वसन् heaving sighs, शोककर्शितः broken with grief, कृताञ्जलिम् with folded palms, उपस्थितम् standing nearby, माम् me, उवाच said.
translation: The griefstricken, glorious ascetic with his face filled with tears, heaving deep sighs broke down with grief and spoke to me as I was standing with folded palms.

text:
यद्येतदशुभं कर्म न त्वं मे कथयेस्स्वयम्।

फलेन्मूर्धा स्म ते राजन् सद्य श्शतसहस्रधा।।2.64.23।।
meaning: राजन् O king, अशुभम् inauspicious, एतत् this, कर्म act, त्वम् you, मे to me, स्वयम् yourself, न कथयेः यदि not spoke, सद्य: right now, ते your, मूर्धा your head, शतसहस्रधा a hundred thousand pieces, फलेत् स्म would have been split.
translation: 'O king, hadn't you yourself broken this inauspicious news, your head would have split into a hundred thousand pieces right now.

text:
क्षत्रियेण वधो राजन् वानप्रस्थे विशेषतः।

ज्ञानपूर्वं कृत स्स्थानाच्च्यावयेदपि वज्रिणम्।।2.64.24।।
meaning: राजन् king, क्षत्रियेण by a kshatriya, ज्ञानपूर्वम् with prior knowledge, कृतः done, वधः the act of killing, विशेषतः especially, वानप्रस्थे of a forestdweller, वज्रिणम् अपि even if he is wielder of thunderbolt (Indra), स्थानात् from his position, च्वावयेत् would overthrow.
translation: 'If a kshatriya kills any one knowingly, particularly when in vanaprastha (third stage) this sin can displace even Indra, wielder of the thunderbolt from his position, O king.

text:
सप्तधा तु फलेन्मूर्धा मुनौ तपसि तिष्ठति।

ज्ञानाद्विसृजतश्शस्त्रं तादृशे ब्रह्मावादिनि।।2.64.25।।
meaning: तपसि observing austerities, तिष्ठति staying, मुनौ at the ascetic, तादृशे similar, ब्रह्मवादिनि at one who propagates selfknowledge, ज्ञानात् knowingly, शस्त्रम् weapon, विसृजतः discharges, मूर्धा head, सप्तधा into seven pieces, फलेत् will break.
translation: 'If any one deliberately discharges a weapon upon an ascetic observing austerities or on him who expounds the Vedas, his head will split into seven pieces.

text:
अज्ञानाद्धिकृतं यस्मादिदं तेनैव जवसि।

अपि ह्यद्य कुलं न स्यादिक्ष्वाकूणां कुतो भवान्।।2.64.26।।
meaning: इदम् this, यस्मात् for which reason, आज्ञानात् out of ignorance, कृतं हि has been done, तेनैव that is why, जीवसि you will live, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् Ikshvakus', कुलमपि race itself, अद्य now, न स्यात् हि would not have been there, भवान् you also, कुतः where are you
translation: 'Since you have done this unwittingly you are still alive. If it had been otherwise, your Ikshvaku race itself would have been exterminated, what to speak of you

text:
नय नौ नृप तं देशमिति मां चाभ्यभाषत।

अद्य तं द्रष्टुमिच्छावः पुत्रं पश्चिमदर्शनम्।।2.64.27।।

रुधिरेणावसिक्ताङ्गं प्रकीर्णाजिनवाससम्।

शयानं भुवि निस्संज्ञं धर्म राजवशं गतम्।।2.64.28।।
meaning: नृप king, अद्य now, पश्चिमदर्शनम् for the last time to see, रुधिरेण in blood, अवसिक्ताङ्गम् his body spattered, प्रकीर्णाजिनवाससम् with antelope skin in disarray, भुवि on the ground, शयानम् lying, निस्संज्ञम् without senses, धर्मराजवशम् under the sway of the Lord of death, गतम् gone, पुत्रम् son, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छावः intend, तं देशम् to that place, नौ us, नय take us, इति thus, माम् me, अभ्यभाषत च spoke.
translation: 'O king take us to that place. We wish to have the last look at him, at his garment of antelope skin in disarray, his body spattered with blood, lying on the ground unconscious under the sway of the lord of death'. Thus the sage said to me.

text:
नय नौ नृप तं देशमिति मां चाभ्यभाषत।

अद्य तं द्रष्टुमिच्छावः पुत्रं पश्चिमदर्शनम्।।2.64.27।।

रुधिरेणावसिक्ताङ्गं प्रकीर्णाजिनवाससम्।

शयानं भुवि निस्संज्ञं धर्म राजवशं गतम्।।2.64.28।।
meaning: नृप king, अद्य now, पश्चिमदर्शनम् for the last time to see, रुधिरेण in blood, अवसिक्ताङ्गम् his body spattered, प्रकीर्णाजिनवाससम् with antelope skin in disarray, भुवि on the ground, शयानम् lying, निस्संज्ञम् without senses, धर्मराजवशम् under the sway of the Lord of death, गतम् gone, पुत्रम् son, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छावः intend, तं देशम् to that place, नौ us, नय take us, इति thus, माम् me, अभ्यभाषत च spoke.
translation: 'O king take us to that place. We wish to have the last look at him, at his garment of antelope skin in disarray, his body spattered with blood, lying on the ground unconscious under the sway of the lord of death'. Thus the sage said to me.

text:
अथाहमेकस्तं देशं नीत्वा तौ भृशदुःखितौ।

अस्पर्शयमहं पुत्रं तं मुनिं सह भार्यया।।2.64.29।।
meaning: अथ thereupon, एकः alone, अहम् I, भृशदुःखितौ deeply grieved, तौ both of them, तं देशम् to that place, नीत्वा having taken, भार्यया सह along with his wife, तं मुनिम् to that asetic, तं पुत्रम् their son, अस्पर्शयम् made them touch.
translation:
Thereupon, I took both of them all by myself to that spot and made the grieving
ascetics touch the body of their son.

text:
तौ पुत्रमात्मन स्स्पृष्ट्वा तमासाद्य तपस्विनौ।

निपेततुश्शरीरेऽस्य पिता चास्येदमब्रवीत्।।62.64.30।।
meaning: तपस्विनौ both the ascetics, तौ both, तम् their, आत्मनः own, पुत्रम् son, आसाद्य having approached, स्पृष्टवा having touched, अस्य his, शरीरे on body, निपेततुः fell, अस्य his, पिता च father, इदम् this way, अब्रवीत् spoke.
translation: Both the ascetics stroking their son's body and collapsed upon it. And the father said:
